panels.description: Total permissible and current allocated memory per pd.
panels.title: Current Memory Allocation

panels.description: Average memory consumption by app containers in each pod.
panels.title: Current Memory Usage
Fatal, Error and Warn logs count

panels.description: Total time taken per method per repository, a high value indicates perf issue.
panels.title: Repository Method Execution Time

panels.description: Number of methods executed against each of repositories, gives an idea of traffic on each collection
panels.title: Repository Method Execution Count

panels.description: Total time taken per method per repository, a high value indicates perf issue.
panels.title: Repository Method Avg Execution Time

panels.description: Max recorded time of each mongo operation
panels.title: Repository Method Execution Max Time

panels.description: The maximum time in seconds it took to execute a particular command on a MongoDB collection. This is the worst case unit. You can use it to identify the slowest operations per collection in your app.
panels.title: Time in Seconds of Operations Per Collection
Number of Commands Per collection Per second

panels.description: The current size of the wait queue for a connection from the pool
panels.title: Mongodb Driver Pool Waitqueuesize

panels.description: Count of connections that are currently in use
panels.title: Mongodb Driver Pool Checkedout

panels.description: An approximation of the percent of CPU time used by GC activities over the last lookback period or since monitoring began, whichever is shorter, in the range [0..1]
panels.title: CPU time used by GC

panels.description: Count of positive increases in the size of the old generation memory pool before GC to after GC
panels.title: Heap Gain Byte Size

panels.description: Max size of long-lived heap memory pool
panels.title: JVM GC Max Data Size Bytes

panels.description: Size of long-lived heap memory pool after reclamation
panels.title: Long Lived Heap Pool
